introduction: The Psychological Process Lab is a virtual simulation lab designed to help students understand and explore core concepts of attention, perception, and memory through hands-on digital experiments. With applications in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), this lab allows users to experience cognitive phenomena such as the Stroop effect, Simon effect, and color blindness, providing insights into human behavior, interface design, and usability engineering.

experiments.name: Stroop Effect - Stroop Colour and Word Test
George Miller Experiment 1956: Capacity of Short-term Memory

UG: B.Tech. / B.E. – Computer Science, ECE, Cognitive Science
PG: M.Tech. / M.Sc. / Ph.D. – Cognitive Science, HCI, Usability Engineering, Design, Psychology

objective:
• Demonstrate psychological processes such as attention, perception, and memory through virtual experimentation.
  • Help students apply these cognitive concepts in the context of human-computer interaction.
  • Provide interactive, data-driven simulations that foster scientific reasoning.
  • Improve understanding of user interface design, usability, and cognitive ergonomics.
  • Enable data collection, logging, and sharing for performance tracking and collaborative learning.
